column5: I'd say this was a 'Good Friday'! The carp were active, even surface feeding and splashing in some spots. Bites were tough as the water was crystal clear, but a lotta chum and a lotta patience, me and the GF were able to land a couple. Good day out, dunkin corn in the backyard.
WTG Rich and your lady friend.
Right on man!   What did ya catch em on? Every time I go fishin' for carps they elude me. They'll be all around the bait... but no takers. Any tips?

Hook/corn on the bottom, and a few cans of sweet sweet chum does the ticket for me!  If you'd ever like to tag along in the spring I'd gladly show you how I do it. I'm not so advanced but I catch a lot of fish, and some real good ones when they run the erie tribs, in about a month !
Beauty backyard you got there Rich.  And a good job by both of ya to catch those beasties at this time of year.  Nice pics and thanks for sharing you day with us.
Now that pike season is closed I'll be starting to go for carp again.
